result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 10-31-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Rahkeib Davon Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Beau Brindley appeared by video for Rahkeib Davon Smith.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Joinder motion addressed. Defense advises does not object to joinder. Court orders cases 2022CF1646 and 22CF1648 joined for trial. Defense advises of intent of filing suppression motion. Court advises of missed deadline. Defense advises in 5 week federal as to why motion was not filed. Court orders suppression motion due on 9-30-2022, state reply due by 11-4-2022 and any reply on 11-11-2022. Case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 4.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court sets additional status in Branch 4 via zoom.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Suppression motion and Joinder due by 8/19/2022. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rahkeib Davon Smith in court, appear by video with attorney Michael J Thompson, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 18CF1816 & 21CF2367. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Kotnik.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rahkeib Davon Smith in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Rahkeib Davon Smith in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rahkeib Davon Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
